column1: Leaving our trap at Briancon and making a hasty breakfast at the Hotel de la Paix
column2: we walked up a very lonely valley towards Cervieres. I dare not say how many hours we wended our way up the brawling torrent without meeting a soul or seeing a human habitation; it was fearfully hot too
column3: and we longed for vin ordinaire; Cervieres seemed as though it never would come--still the same rugged precipices
column9: sky cloudless. At last we are there; through the town
column12: the dismantled houses and gaping walls affording palpable traces of the fearful inundations of the previous year

column15: and more such as I am sure few of us would like to inhabit. However
column16: it is Cervieres such as it is
column17: and we hope for our vin ordinaire; but
